revised_title: Exploring Modal and Quantized Variation in Intraspecific Development
tldr: The authors discuss the problem of explaining modal characters in development, specifically when the modal number is large. They explore the relationship between continuous, quantized, and modal variation and suggest that processes of simple quantization can account for modal numbers up to about 5 to 7. Larger modal numbers require more accurate regulation of continuous variables, which may be achieved through multiplicative processes or chemical counting processes.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
